column1: Haysend was the village at the southern tip of Buckland
column2: at the place where the River Withywindle flowed out of the Old Forest into the Brandywine. It was named for the fact that it stood at the end of the High Hay
column3: the Hedge raised to protect the Bucklanders from the strange things that lived in the Forest and beyond it.

column1: According to the poem "Bombadil Goes Boating"
column2: its inhabitants had a more fierce and protective attitude than most Hobbits
column3: which is hardly surprising given the perilous location of their village.

column2: the end of the hedge or boundary-hedge.
